elements.name: question1
elements.title:
The legal rules lead to different solutions for the two cases: 
Decide which of the two can withdraw from the contract and which cannot. Give brief and precise reasons for your two decisions:
elements.correctAnswer:
Situation 1: Mia cannot withdraw from the contract. In principle, the following applies here: A purchase is a purchase. The store is not legally obliged to take the dress back. However, there are stores that are accommodating. 
Fact 2: Bastian can withdraw from the contract. Leasing contracts can be canceled within 14 days of receiving a copy of the contract.

elements.name: question7
elements.title: Convert the legal rule for fact 3 into an if-then statement by completing the sentence accordingly. Tip: You can simply omit the term "explanatory error".
elements.placeHolder: Wenn eine durch einen Fehler verursachte …, dann …
elements.correctAnswer: If there is a massive difference between the price quoted and the actual value of the object of purchase due to an error, then a seller can rely on this and therefore does not have to sell the object at the price quoted.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: What price can Paula now buy the T-shirt for? Give reasons. Tip: Think about whether the if part is fulfilled.
elements.correctAnswer: The difference between the quoted price (CHF 30) and the actual value of the purchased item (CHF 35) is not significant -> If part not fulfilled -> Then part does not apply => The store must give Paula the T-shirt for CHF 30.
